title: cellbender_remove_background
description:
Eliminating technical artifacts from high-throughput single-cell RNA sequencing data.

This module removes counts due to ambient RNA molecules and random barcode swapping from (raw) UMI-based scRNA-seq count matrices. 
At the moment, only the count matrices produced by the CellRanger count pipeline is supported. Support for additional tools and protocols 
will be added in the future. A quick start tutorial can be found here.

Fleming et al. 2022, bioRxiv.

output.description: Full count matrix as an h5mu file, with background RNA removed. This file contains all the original droplet barcodes.

expected_cells.description: Number of cells expected in the dataset (a rough estimate within a factor of 2 is sufficient).

total_droplets_included.description: The number of droplets from the rank-ordered UMI plot
total_droplets_included.help_text:
The number of droplets from the rank-ordered UMI plot
that will be analyzed. The largest 'total_droplets'
droplets will have their cell probabilities inferred
as an output.

expected_cells_from_qc.description: Will use the Cell Ranger QC to determine the estimated number of cells

model.description: Which model is being used for count data. 'simple'
model.help_text:
Which model is being used for count data. 'simple'
does not model either ambient RNA or random barcode
swapping (for debugging purposes -- not recommended).
'ambient' assumes background RNA is incorporated into
droplets. 'swapping' assumes background RNA comes from
random barcode swapping. 'full' uses a combined
ambient and swapping model.

low_count_threshold.description: Droplets with UMI counts below this number are completely
low_count_threshold.help_text:
Droplets with UMI counts below this number are completely 
excluded from the analysis. This can help identify the correct 
prior for empty droplet counts in the rare case where empty 
counts are extremely high (over 200).

z_layers.description: Dimension of hidden layers in the encoder for z.
z_layers.help_text: Dimension of hidden layers in the encoder for z.

training_fraction.description: Training detail: the fraction of the data used for training.
training_fraction.help_text:
Training detail: the fraction of the data used for training.
The rest is never seen by the inference algorithm. Speeds up learning.

empty_drop_training_fraction.description: Training detail: the fraction of the training data each epoch that
empty_drop_training_fraction.help_text:
Training detail: the fraction of the training data each epoch that 
is drawn (randomly sampled) from surely empty droplets.

fpr.description: Target false positive rate in (0, 1). A false positive
fpr.help_text:
Target false positive rate in (0, 1). A false positive
is a true signal count that is erroneously removed.
More background removal is accompanied by more signal
removal at high values of FPR. You can specify
multiple values, which will create multiple output
files.

exclude_antibody_capture.help_text:
Including the flag --exclude-antibody-capture will
cause remove-background to operate on gene counts
only, ignoring other features.

learning_rate.description: Training detail: lower learning rate for inference. A
learning_rate.help_text:
Training detail: lower learning rate for inference. A
OneCycle learning rate schedule is used, where the
upper learning rate is ten times this value. (For this
value, probably do not exceed 1e-3).

cuda.description: Including the flag --cuda will run the inference on a
cuda.help_text:
Including the flag --cuda will run the inference on a
GPU.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

param_list.description: Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
param_list.help_text:
Allows inputting multiple parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel. Possible formats are csv, json, yaml, or simply a yaml_blob.
A csv should have column names which correspond to the different arguments of this pipeline.
A json or a yaml file should be a list of maps, each of which has keys corresponding to the arguments of the pipeline.
A yaml blob can also be passed directly as a parameter.
Inside the Nextflow pipeline code, params.params_list can also be used to directly a list of parameter sets.
When passing a csv, json or yaml, relative path names are relativized to the location of the parameter file.

param_list_format.description: Manually specify the param_list_format. Must be one of 'csv', 'json', 'yaml', 'yaml_blob', 'asis' or 'none'.
